job_title: Administrative Assistant IV in Houston, TX
pros: Great place to work. Six year tenure.
cons: None to mention. Positive experience.

job_title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer in Houston, TX
pros: -Great team -great people -gain lots of experience
cons: -low pay -work on a skeleton crew -shift coverage is poor -turnover is high

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Houston, TX
pros: Their residency program was helpful starting out Good family environment
cons: Administration can sometimes be political about hospital policies and care

job_title: Registered Nurse in El Paso, TX
pros: The coworkers were some of the nicest people I met.
cons: Low morale due to poor management/administration which has a high turnover , overworked staff

pros: Great people. Staff is experienced and work well as a team.
cons: Low pay. Benefits are below average. People call off a lot so people are asked to work on their days off. The managers make sure to only ask those who won't go into overtime to come in and cover. Overtime is discouraged.

review_title: Elect. Tech seeking Assistant Project Management Position
pros: Benefits, fairly stable work, good co-workers and medical staff.
cons: Doing non-electrical work, higher education not recognized with job responsibilities.

pros: Coworkers, coworkers, diversity , coworkers , diversity
cons: Hourly pay , atmosphere, management, unorganized

pros: Great 401 K matching benefits
cons: tight budget and staffing control

pros:
It's a job
convenient location
If I think of more pros will come back and edit
cons:
-unsafe staffing
-often so desperate for staff to cover patient load, they'll allow an unqualified nurse to care for a high acuity patient to 'get through' the night.
-not enough equipment (or it's broken) to do job
-if seeking certification or other training, you're on your own...no conferences or certifications paid by hospital
-snap decisions made by administration that are not well thought out (causes lots of embarrassing confusion)
-administration has NO connection with actual workers ( concerns and complaints are largely ignored-just get things done or else)
-low raises, no incentive (except a $25 target gift card around holidays)
-terrible benefits and retirement
-high turnover

review_title: A very enlightening and unique experience!
pros: the hospital is very accessible, it's near where I live, and my co-workers are always ready to help and support the people around them.
cons: They do not pay as much as the other hospitals in the area. We are understaffed half of the time. They cater to the doctors too much to the point where their own staff who want to stay on or who have been there for a long time end up getting frustrated and end up leaving.

review_title: Great place to work however they do not do a good job at allowing employees to balance work and home life
pros: The nurses are competent and provide excellent patient care. Some of the higher level staff and management are very friendly and team based
cons: they do not do a good job at allowing employees to balance work and home life. Some managers will take the nurses from patient care to have a meeting and then your work is behind

review_title: They do not care about their staff. No support.
pros: LOTS of overtime available due to shortage of staff.
cons: No employee appreciation. Low morale. Administration has the attitude of "It's our way, or else!" No employee input. Changes are made quickly without input or any well thought-out processing. Low pay. Understaffed 90 percent of the time and workload increases daily. Whatever the max staffing ratio is, it's always pushed to the max and even then may go over the recommended ratio. Very high turnover. Unsafe.

review_title: Tough place to work, bad processes. Good pay until  HCA took over. They do trauma well and some of the docs are great.
pros: The pay was good until CHA took over. They do trauma well, and most of the docs are great.
cons: For hospital located in the hood, co-workers are racists. Patients are treated bad, Too many psych patients at one time assigned to 1 nurse. Manage uncaring of staff needs until something bad happens.

pros: The people are wonderful and care about their jobs. The 401(k) has a 100% match up to 9% of pay (depending on seniority).
cons: Pay is average. No sign on bonus in my field.

pros: The process of having an interview to getting your physical and start date was fast
cons: The company they use, hire right, is a pain in the you know what. They ask you for a document concerning your work history, you give it to them, and they still ask for more. Get a new background checking agency.

pros: I enjoy the management and the atmosphere. I’ve been working here for years and now I feel it’s time to change
cons: The hospital was bought by another company and things have changed

review_title: I am experienced in technical training and tasks with in the lab. Implement successful events for the facility.
pros: Great working atmosphere, and the people are like your family away from home.
cons: Facility not recognized for their efforts in greate patient care nearly enough as other hospitals.

review_title: It has been a rewarding experience.
pros: Leaders inform you of changes. The hospital is making great strides to compete with other hospitals and bring in more customers.
cons: Not much room for promotions. Compensation in comparison to other hospitals seems to be on the lower end.

pros: Vast Amount of Experience learned, co-workers were a bast to work with
cons: worked in Case Management and the Directors bottom line was not about the patients or her employees but how fast can we get the patient out of the hospital

pros: great co-workers, we work as a team and work well together
cons: very busy not enough help and equipment is not up to date

pros: Long term employees, growth opportunity, great leadership teams.
cons: Employees in lead roles did not leave so in order to promote up you had to transfer.

coworkers

pros: Lots of teamwork, decent benefits, opportunities to grow
cons: Poor staffing constantly, mgmt needs to be proactive and not reactive

pros: Great people to work with.  Doctors are very easy to work for.
cons: Was too far to drive for me

pros: Great Company, made changes once HCA bought Tenet.
cons: Made trauma center and closed our department, resulting in lay off.

pros: Paid time off rate is decent in comparison to other companies. Decent 401k plan if you decide to take part in it.
cons:
Management has alot of favoritism and it is clear in the way employees are treated. 
No set schedule always rotating.
